hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Crash Recovery Asymmetry
hypothesis_content.statement: After a sharp liquidity contraction event (like October's crash), ETH/BTC pair exhibits predictable mean reversion: ETH underperforms initially but outperforms BTC by 2-4% in the 10 days following the market's return to NEUTRAL regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During liquidity crises, money flows to 'safe haven' crypto (BTC). As conditions normalize, capital rotates back to higher-beta assets (ETH). The reversion is mechanical as market makers rebuild inventory.
entry_conditions: Crypto market liquidity metric (aggregate bid-ask spread) has widened by >30% in prior 2 weeks
Market regime transitions from STRESS to NEUTRAL (confidence shift > 20 points)
ETH/BTC ratio is >1.5% below its 30-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC ratio returns to its 30-day average
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio falls to new 20-day low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETH/BTC ratio continues to decline or shows no mean reversion (>1%) in 3 consecutive STRESS→NEUTRAL transitions.
